channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Reinventing arts and culture during COVID-19
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: With mass gatherings prohibited due to the coronavirus disease 2019, the arts and culture sector is looking at ways to reinvent itself to a “new normal” in the post-pandemic recovery period.

item.title: SC decision on Cebu exams paves way for Bar regionalization
item.author: Evelyn Macairan
item.description: The regionalization of the Bar exams for 2021 is a dream come true for former University of Cebu-College of Law dean Baldomero Estenzo, who has pushed for it for more than a decade.

item.title: PNP: Smooth 1st day of GCQ implementation
item.author: Romina Cabrera
item.description: The first day of the implementation of the general community quarantine in many parts of the country went smoothly, a ranking police official said yesterday.

item.title: Gas prices seen higher, diesel down
item.author: Danessa Rivera
item.description: Oil companies are expected to reduce diesel prices but raise gasoline rates this week.

item.title: Villar: ‘Build Build Build’ to resume in GCQ areas
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: After the government placed some areas in the country under general community quarantine status, Department of Public Works and Highways Secretary Mark Villar announced the partial resumption of Build Build Build projects in those places.

item.title: Various learning strategies eyed for basic education
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: As the threat of a coronavirus disease 2019 infection is expected to remain even after the quarantine regulations are relaxed, the Department of Education has started to consider various learning strategies that could be adopted once schools are allowed to reopen.

item.title: Government urged to provide smooth transition for students
item.description: Sen. Bong Go emphasized yesterday the need to prepare schools in different parts of the country for the expected transfer of students from urban areas as more Filipinos express willingness to relocate to their home provinces after the coronavirus disease health emergency.

item.title: Senator COVID positive anew
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: Sen. Sonny Angara, who recovered from the coronavirus disease 2019 last month, has tested positive anew for the virus after two negative test results.

item.title: Tagle elevated to Cardinal Bishop
item.author: Robertzon Ramirez
item.description: Former Manila Archbishop Luis Antonio Cardinal Tagle has been elevated to a cardinal bishop, the highest rank in the College of Cardinals at the Vatican.

item.title: Journalists also hailed as heroes
item.author: Artemio Dumlao
item.description: Considered as frontliners in the fight against coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), journalists and media professionals were hailed by the Philippine government as “heroes.”
